roleset.name: establish the truth
roleset.note: PROVE-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls declare-29.4-1-1, deduce-97.2, indicate-78-1-1. (from prove.01-v)
PROOF-N NOTES: Roleset based on prove.01. Verbnet class 29.4. Framed by Katie. (from proof.01-n)
PROVEN-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from proven.01-j)

roles.note: 'X proved to be Y' constructions require concatenation. (from prove.01-v)

example.name: prove-v: prove an NP
example.text: ``We-1 look upon this as a great opportunity *-1 to prove the fact that we have a tremendous management team,'' he said.
example.arg: the fact that we have a tremendous management team

example.name: prove-v: prove an SBAR
example.text: ``Wall Street's cash cow has been gored, but I don't think anyone has proven that index arbitrage is the problem.''
example.arg: that index arbitrage is the problem

example.name: prove-v: unaccusative, adjectival predicate, with concatenation
example.text: Dealers said institutions were still largely hugging the sidelines on fears that [the market's recent technical rally]-1 might prove *-1 fragile.

example.name: prove-v: unaccusative, NP predicate, with concatenation
example.text: His client contacts, meanwhile, could prove a gold mine for an agency that has had few new business wins of late.
example.arg: [His client contacts],[a gold mine for an agency that has had few new business wins of late]

example.name: prove-v: with benefactive
example.text: John proved to Mary that he could kiss his own elbow.
example.arg: that he could kiss his own elbow

example.name: proof-n: All args
example.text: Their proof for the DA of his drug use was compelling

roleset.name: make secure; make impervious to
roleset.note: PROOF-V NOTES: Frame created by Jena. (from proof.01-v)

example.name: proof-v
example.text: They focused on underground earthquake-proofing work.
